commitResults.messageTitle: Change bot name to Tyrone
Add echo function
Implement Add Task and List Task features
commitResults.messageBody:
Tasks are added, stored and listed using a new class
TaskList in TaskList.java for greater neatness of code

commitResults.messageTitle: Add mark/unmark task feature
commitResults.messageBody:
Create new class Task in Task.java to record
description and whether task is done

commitResults.messageTitle: Make minor tweaks to comply with coding standard
Add CommandHandler class to handle commands
commitResults.messageBody:
Extracting code to parse and handle commands from main to a new class
allows for greater readability of main code.

Let's extract code to parse and handle commands to a new class
CommandHandler.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Todo class to keep track of Todo tasks
Add Deadline class to track deadlines
Add Event class to track event tasks
Refactor handleCommand by extracting multiple methods
commitResults.messageBody:
Before this, handleCommand was a very long method with poor
readability.

Let's extract out code in handleCommand into multiple methods, with
one method to handle each command type. This shortens the
handleCommand method which makes it much more readable.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add input.txt to allow for semi-automated testing
Amend Tyrone main method to improve readability
commitResults.messageBody:
Main path (handleCommand) was initially indented in an if block
which checks if the bye command has been entered.

Let's amend the code to reduce the level of indentation of the main
path.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add error handling for Deadline and Event tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
Program would crash when Deadline/Event tasks were input
improperly (i.e. task deadline/start/end was missing or input without
proper flag)

Let's add try-catch statements to handle the exceptions arising from
these situations, and print out the proper format for inputting
Deadline/Event tasks when user inputs Deadline/Event tasks with the
incorrect format.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add handleUnknown method to handle unknown commands
Add error handling for mark/unmark tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
Code crashes when mark/unmark commands were input with no index or
non-numeric index.

Let's add try-catch statements to handle missing index or non-numeric
index being input into the program, which will also print an error
message informing the user of the mistake they made in inputting the
command.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add error handling to handle empty input fields for tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
Program allows users to successfully log tasks with empty descriptions,
deadlines, start times or end times.

This is bad as it can potentially allow for tasks with empty fields to
be logged which may confuse the user later on.

Let's create a EmptyFieldException class to flag empty deadline/
start date/end date inputs. handleTodo, handleDeadline and handleEvent
methods will throw a EmptyFieldException upon detecting empty field
inputs, which triggers the program to print an error message informing
the user not to input empty fields.

A new EmptyFieldException class was used to clearly signal to future
code readers that the code is meant to handle errors regarding empty
fields.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor hasNonWhitespaceChar method to hasOnlyWhitespaceChar method
commitResults.messageBody:
Program checks for empty input fields (description/deadline/start/end)
by checking if hasNonWhitespaceChar returns false for these fields.

This creates unnecessary confusion for future readers of the code.

Let's refactor the hasNonWhitespaceChar method to hasOnlyWhitespaceChar
such that the program detects empty fields when hasOnlyWhitespaceChar
returns true.

This helps make reading the code less confusing by removing
negation signs in the conditional statements when checking for
empty fields.

commitResults.messageTitle: Sort files into different packages for easier organization
Change TaskList to store tasks using ArrayList instead of array
commitResults.messageBody:
TaskList uses a fixed-sized array to store tasks.

This limits the number of tasks we can store in our list and is
inefficient in terms of memory usage as we cannot dynamically size
the array.

Let's replace the array of tasks with an ArrayList to store the tasks.

This lets us store and unlimited number of tasks and allows more
efficient use of memory through dynamic sizing of the ArrayList.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement Delete Task feature
Add getAllTaskDetails method to TaskList class
commitResults.messageBody:
Program has no means of retrieving all tasks logged in TaskList,
making writing the list of tasks to a new file difficult.

Let's create a method getAllTaskDetails that compiles the details of
all logged tasks and returns it as a single string.

This allows the program to write all tasks onto an external file
easily.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add methods to create and update save file
commitResults.messageBody:
Program does not save tasks logged into it, meaning all data is lost
once the program is closed.

Let's create a FileReadWriter class with methods to create a new file
to store the logged tasks and write the list of all logged tasks to it
whenever the list of tasks is updated.

Feature of reading from the save file is a work in progress.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement feature to save tasks in external .txt file
Implement Read Task list from save file feature
commitResults.messageBody:
Program saves list of tasks to external file but does not read from
the file to access the saved task list.

Let's add an initTaskListFromSaveFile method in FileReadWriter class
which populates TaskList according to the list of tasks logged in
the save file.

This allows the program to initialize its list of tasks according to
the list of tasks as of the program's last closure. FileReadWriter has
also been added to a new savemanager package for better organization of
files.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix getAllTaskDetails method to work with ArrayList task list
Refactor CommandHandler to InputHandler
commitResults.messageBody:
Entire user input is saved as command variable, which is handled by
CommandHandler class.

Let's refactor our code to relabel the user's input as input, which
allows us to name the command type of the user input (todo, deadline,
etc.) as 'command'.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor magic literals to constant variables
Replace hasOnlyWhitespaceChar method with isBlank method
Change format of reading/writing data in Tyrone.txt
commitResults.messageBody:
Data format of reading/writing Tyrone.txt allows for errors to arise
from the way the user writes the task descriptions (e.g. if description
contains "(by: " substring.)

Let's change the format in which data is written to and read from
Tyrone.txt to greater resemble the user input format so as to
reduce likelihood of an erronous update of TaskList from Tyrone.txt
arising from format of user-input description.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update print messages of methods to parse Tyrone.txt
Refactor printList method to return String instead of void
commitResults.messageBody:
The printList method prints the list of tasks directly.

Let's :
* refactor the method to return a String of the list of tasks
instead. This allows us to use a Ui class to print the list of tasks
instead for better adherence to the OOP Single Responsibility
Principle.
* rename method to getAllTaskDetails to better describe newly
refactored method's function
* rename original getAllTaskDetails method to getAllTaskSaveRecords to
prevent the 2 methods from sharing the same name

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Ui class to handle printing to UI and receiving user inputs
Remove redundant import in Ui class
